文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_032_chunk1
证据片段: It is shown that, to initiate an unstable fast fracture during operation of Zircaloy-2 pressure tubes used in the Steam Generating Heavy Water Reactor, a defect more than 4 in. long and having a depth 80 percent through the wall has to be present.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_032_chunk1
证据片段: The effect of hydrides oriented in both the circumferential and radial directions is discussed, and it is concluded that the hydrogen absorbed during a 30 year life should have no significant effect on the critical defect size.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_032_chunk1
证据片段: Simlarly, it is shown that fast neutron damage will not have a deleterious effect on the critical defect size.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_032_chunk1
证据片段: The pressure tubes pass through calandria tubes which are an integral part of the tank, and a carbon dioxide gas blanket between the pressure tubes and calandria tubes provides insulation and allows the moderator to be maintained at a low temperature (~80°C).

证据片段: The critical defect length for unirradiated, unhydrided tube under a hoop stress of 16 ksi was found to be 4 in., remaining approximately constant between ambient temperature and 300°C (design temperature)

证据片段: Tests carried out on prehydrided specimens have shown that at low temperatures the critical defect length is reduced by hydrogen, 200 ppm for example, reducing the critical length at ambient temperature to approximately 2 in.

证据片段: Recent results obtained from corrosion monitoring specimens removed from the Winfrith SGHWR have indicated that the maximum hydrogen absorption during a 2000000 h life (30 years at 75 percent load factor) would be 260 ppm [7]
